image.altText: Police and ambulance workers at the scene of a fatal bus crash.

props.synopsis: At least three people are dead and several seriously injured after a Greyhound bus carrying 33 people collided with a four-wheel drive in north Queensland.

title.children: 'Very significant' bus crash kills three, several more injured

image.altText: A father reunites with his children and wife who have travelled from Afghanistan at the airport.

props.synopsis: Afghan refugee Mohammad Rezayi fled his home, saying goodbye to his wife and four young children with the hope of sending them when he got to Australia. That was 12 years ago.

title.children: Refugee Mohammad has been in Australia without his family for more than a decade — until now

image.altText: A photo of various vape parts: batteries, leads, plastics, casings etc

props.synopsis: There are no practical means to collect or recycle vapes, and most end up as electronic waste in landfill. Some are simply thrown on the street as litter. So what's really inside vapes?

title.children: Disposable vapes are not designed to be disassembled. We pulled some apart anyway — here's what we found

image.altText: An emergency services tent on a pier

props.synopsis: A 36-year-old man of no fixed address has appeared in court, after being charged with murdering a fisherman on Frankston Pier.

title.children: Man charged with murder over death at popular fishing spot in Melbourne's south-east

image.altText: Chris Martin from Coldplay on stage singing with a microphone in hand and the band behind him

props.synopsis: From Coldplay's record-breaking headline set to Michael J Fox strumming away on an electric guitar, there was something for everyone.

title.children: Michael J Fox joins Coldplay on guitar during Glastonbury headlining set

image.altText: A smiling AFL coach holds hands with one of his players after a game.

props.synopsis: Ken Hinkley shows his emotions after Port Adelaide's vital win, as the Blues facee Richmond and West Coast hosts the Hawks to bring round 16 to a close. Follow live.

title.children: 'It's been a tough week': Ken Hinkley shows the emotions after vital Port win, as Blues face Tigers

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: HT: Carlton leads Richmond by 12 points
QT: Carlton leads Richmond by three points
FT: Port Adelaide beats St Kilda by two points!

image.altText: Tim Franklin raises his arms as he approaches the finish line

props.synopsis: It was an epic effort that involved thousands of kilometres and 21 pairs of shoes. On Sunday Tim Franklin ended his round-the-world run where he began, in Brisbane.

title.children: Runner Tim Franklin ends 576-day run around the world in Brisbane

image.altText: Wind turbine fire

props.synopsis: The blaze at the top of the turbine in Portland had to be left to burn overnight after firefighters were unable to extinguish it.

title.children: Investigation launched into wind turbine fire in Victoria

image.altText: Nurses Marita Rees, Anne Myers and Anne-Marie Jackson sit on a bench in the park, laughing together.

props.synopsis: Three palliative care nurses with decades of experience alongside death share their lessons on how to live and die well.

title.children: Palliative care nurses see us in our final hours — these are the life lessons they've learnt

image.altText: 1950s house in black and white

props.synopsis: Why did we make it harder for younger Australians and low-income workers to own homes? Did we forget some wisdom from the past?

title.children: Do you love renting? Does it make you feel patriotic?

image.altText: Senator Fatima Payman with hand on her mouth at Environment estimates committee

props.synopsis: Labor senator Fatima Payman has been "indefinitely suspended" from the Labor Party caucus by the prime minister after a series of defiant actions regarding her support for Palestine.

title.children: Payman 'indefinitely suspended' from Labor Party caucus

image.altText: a huge ship with beams and pipe-laying equipment

props.synopsis: Santos is pursuing the climate movement through the courts after winning a challenge brought by traditional owners against a massive gas project. Experts warn it could help spell the end of public interest litigation in Australia.

title.children: 'Litigate you to death': Gas giant uses new tactic which could sink environmental dissenters

image.altText: Sweeney teaser image

props.synopsis: Parts of Australia are recording their coldest temperatures in more than a decade, and people sleeping rough are bearing the brunt more than ever.

title.children: 'Too cold to sleep': Homeless campers battle rain, mould and the unknown as winter temperatures plummet

image.altText: An abstract image of yellow planets embedded in a purple space-time, warping under their mass.

props.synopsis: There's a 100-year-old conundrum in physics that we're still yet to untangle, and it has to do with the very nature of space-time itself.

title.children: Want a lifetime supply of chips? All you have to do is solve Einstein's incomplete theory of gravity

image.altText: Shane Rose rode Virgil to silver in Tokyo.

props.synopsis: Mankini-gate is what Shane Rose thought might bring his Olympic dream undone but he's had to fight through more than that after a 625-kilogram horse named Bandit came crashing down upon him.

title.children: Shane Rose is more than a mankini-clad larrikin. He's a triple-Olympic medallist chasing a near-impossible gold

image.altText: A large, red ferry with a smaller pilot boat in front

props.synopsis: Replacing the two Bass Strait ferries has been far from plain sailing, with operator TT-Line facing obstacle after obstacle. This week, the state-owned company detailed how it came to the decision to pay the shipbuilder an extra $81 million, while copping a 400 per cent blowout in wharf upgrade costs — without telling the public.

title.children: '30 million euro was not going to do it': Details emerge about the project to replace the Spirit of Tasmania ferries

image.altText: A composite image of Mitch McConnel, Joe Biden, Donald Trump and Nancy Pelosi.

props.synopsis: In the lead-up to the US election, many are concerned that Biden and Trump, the two oldest people to ever run for office in the US, are running again. It's indicative of a broader issue — the average age of the US congress has been climbing for decades.

title.children: The debate has US voters asking, how old is too old to be president? But it's a bigger problem than Biden and Trump

image.altText: The red earth corrugations of an old mine pit surround a beautiful blue lake at the bottom.

props.synopsis: Now a ghost town, the community of Mary Kathleen disappeared after the nearby uranium mine closed in 1982. But in its heyday, it was an oasis in outback Queensland.

title.children: The final days of a ghost uranium mining town, shuttered and sold for parts

image.altText: Trevor Andrei stands in a short with his name on the front at his property in regional Victoria on a summer day

props.synopsis: Trevor Andrei is a self-described doomsday prepper and survival guide. But it's not just people fearing the end of days that are coming to him for help, as the cost-of-living crisis bites hard.

title.children: Parents 'panicked out of their mind' by cost of living turn to doomsday prepper for help

image.altText: Land Rovers on a misty mountain

props.synopsis: Four-wheel drives are commonplace in Australia, but that wasn't always the way.

title.children: How Australia changed the 4WD that's influenced designs across the world

image.altText: A woman sits looking into the distance.

props.synopsis: A brother lost in the bush, a sister who never came home, a missing backpacker and a mum likely murdered. These are the families left behind after a loved one vanished without a trace.

title.children: 56,000 people were reported missing in Australia last year. The families of those who haven't come home never stop searching

image.altText: Tom Gleeson standing with his arms crossed and a serious look on his face. The Hard Quiz has been added behind his head

props.synopsis: Back again, I see, and clearly with something to prove. Let's see if that confidence is misguided.

title.children: Think you're smarter than a Hard Quiz contestant? I'll believe it when I see it

image.altText: Benjamin Netanyahu grins as he sits behind two small microphones mounted to a desk in front of an Israeli flag.

props.synopsis: Benjamin Netanyahu regains favour with voters, and even though his government has lost significant ground eight months into the war in Gaza, it seems reports of his political demise have been exaggerated again.

title.children: Israeli prime minster's poll numbers bounce back just months after crashing

image.altText: Pat Anderson gives evidence at a parliamentary committee

props.synopsis: Uluru Dialogues chair Pat Anderson has urged the government not to use the defeated referendum as a reason to stall work on other areas of Indigenous policy, arguing the Voice was a specific answer to a specific question.

title.children: Nine months on from the Voice referendum, its architects are pushing for new action

image.altText: Nigel Farage on stage

props.synopsis: Nigel Farage says someone "needs to get the sack" as a banner mocking his support for Vladimir Putin hangs behind him on a campaign stop.

title.children: Putin banner lowered by activists during Nigel Farage speech

image.altText: Morgan Freeman looks ahead while participating in a National Geographic panel.

props.synopsis: Freeman's opposition comes after the CEO of his production company said she had been personally duped by the AI likeness.

title.children: Actor Morgan Freeman slams AI imitations, calling for 'authenticity and integrity'

image.altText: A composite image of a bright red and white sign that says 'coles' and a white sign that says 'woolworths' with a green icon.

props.synopsis: Food, mortgages and power bills — with the cost of living dominating, will this week’s supermarket inquiry make a difference?

title.children: Will the cost of living ever go down? Food prices are on the rise despite multiple supermarket inquiries

image.altText: Alessandro Bastoni of Italy lies on the ground after loss to Switzerland at Euro 2024.

props.synopsis: Italy is out after going down to Switzerland, as the pundits sink the boot into the defending champions, while Germany progresses to the quarterfinals. Here are the five quick hits from the latest Euro 2024 action.

title.children: Euro 2024 five quick hits — Italy labelled worst in a 'lifetime', Germany conquers Danes, thunder and hail

image.altText: a large police sign on a metal structure

props.synopsis: A sprawling fight in the Kimberley community of Halls Creek has raised concerns about violence becoming normalised, prompting calls for greater leadership.

title.children: Police fly into remote town to quell 'totally unacceptable' brawl as offenders brandish knives and metal bars

image.altText: A woman with long blond hair and dark rim glasses smiling

props.synopsis: How do we ensure that our teenagers reach out to us when things take a turn for the worse? Bec Sparrow shares the top three tips she has learned from the experts in Parental As Anything Teens this season.

title.children: Parenting teenagers can be challenging. But there's at least one piece of advice most experts agree on

image.altText: woman smiles as she puts blue drink on bench

props.synopsis: After struggling through her final year at school and hustling in a 9-5 job, Sophia Antoncic packed up and moved to a tropical island. She hasn't looked back.

title.children: The young Aussies ditching hustle culture for a slower lifestyle amid high rates of burnout

image.altText: Bruce Lehrman leaves the Federal Court of Australia in Sydney.

props.synopsis: Justice Michael Lee hoped to rule "quick and dirty" on costs in the Bruce Lehrmann case last week, to save everybody's money. But the truth is there's been nothing quick about it, and it is far from over — especially with an appeal looming.

title.children: The judge wanted to rule 'quick and dirty' on costs in Bruce Lehrmann's failed defamation case, but it's far from over

image.altText: An aerial view of four children swimming backstroke in a clear blue pool

props.synopsis: These desert lifeguards want more remote swimming pools to be reopened, revitalised, and maintained to unlock the many benefits they offer.

title.children: 'It's going to change my life': Unlocking the benefits of Australia's remote pools

image.altText: A woman smiling.

props.synopsis: The family of Sarah Miles, who was allegedly murdered in her home at Casino, northern NSW, have thanked first responders who tried to help the much-loved mother.

title.children: Sarah Miles remembered as 'loving, talented' mother, as partner is charged with murder
